verses.verse: And there was <WH1961> a famine <WH7458> in the land, <WH776> beside <WH4480> <WH905> the first <WH7223> famine <WH7458> that <WH834> was <WH1961> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham. <WH85> And Isaac <WH3327> went <WH1980> unto <WH413> Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> unto Gerar. <WH1642>

And the LORD <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> him, and said, <WH559> Go not down <WH3381> <WH408> into Egypt; <WH4714> dwell <WH7931> in the land <WH776> which <WH834> I shall tell <WH559> thee of: <WH413>

Sojourn <WH1481> in this <WH2063> land, <WH776> and I will be <WH1961> with <WH5973> thee, and will bless <WH1288> thee; for <WH3588> unto thee, and unto thy seed, <WH2233> I will give <WH5414> <WH853> all <WH3605> these <WH411> countries, <WH776> and I will perform <WH6965> <WH853> the oath <WH7621> which <WH834> I swore <WH7650> unto Abraham <WH85> thy father; <WH1>

And I will make <WH853> thy seed <WH2233> to multiply <WH7235> as the stars <WH3556> of heaven, <WH8064> and will give <WH5414> unto thy seed <WH2233> <WH853> all <WH3605> these <WH411> countries; <WH776> and in thy seed <WH2233> shall all <WH3605> the nations <WH1471> of the earth <WH776> be blessed; <WH1288>
Because <WH6118> that <WH834> Abraham <WH85> obeyed <WH8085> my voice, <WH6963> and kept <WH8104> my charge, <WH4931> my commandments, <WH4687> my statutes, <WH2708> and my laws. <WH8451>
And Isaac <WH3327> dwelt <WH3427> in Gerar: <WH1642>

And the men <WH376> of the place <WH4725> asked <WH7592> him of his wife; <WH802> and he said, <WH559> She <WH1931> is my sister: <WH269> for <WH3588> he feared <WH3372> to say, <WH559> She is my wife; <WH802> lest, <WH6435> said he, the men <WH376> of the place <WH4725> should kill <WH2026> me for <WH5921> Rebekah; <WH7259> because <WH3588> she <WH1931> was fair <WH2896> to look upon. <WH4758>

And it came to pass, <WH1961> when <WH3588> he had been there <WH8033> a long <WH748> time, <WH3117> that Abimelech <WH40> king <WH4428> of the Philistines <WH6430> looked out <WH8259> at <WH1157> a window, <WH2474> and saw, <WH7200> and, behold, <WH2009> Isaac <WH3327> was sporting <WH6711> with <WH853> Rebekah <WH7259> his wife. <WH802>

And Abimelech <WH40> called <WH7121> Isaac, <WH3327> and said, <WH559> Behold, <WH2009> of a surety <WH389> she <WH1931> is thy wife: <WH802> and how <WH349> saidst <WH559> thou, She <WH1931> is my sister? <WH269> And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto <WH413> him, Because <WH3588> I said, <WH559> Lest <WH6435> I die <WH4191> for <WH5921> her.

And Abimelech <WH40> said, <WH559> What <WH4100> is this <WH2063> thou hast done <WH6213> unto us? one <WH259> of the people <WH5971> might lightly <WH4592> have lain <WH7901> with <WH854> thy wife, <WH802> and thou shouldest have brought <WH935> guiltiness <WH817> upon <WH5921> us.

And Abimelech <WH40> charged <WH6680> <WH853> all <WH3605> his people, <WH5971> saying, <WH559> He that toucheth <WH5060> this <WH2088> man <WH376> or his wife <WH802> shall surely be put to death. <WH4191> <WH4191>
Then Isaac <WH3327> sowed <WH2232> in that <WH1931> land, <WH776> and received <WH4672> in the same <WH1931> year <WH8141> a hundredfold: <WH3967> <WH8180> and the LORD <WH3068> blessed <WH1288> him.
And the man <WH376> waxed great, <WH1431> and went <WH1980> forward, <WH1980> and grew <WH1432> until <WH5704> <WH3588> he became very great: <WH1431> <WH3966>
For he had <WH1961> possession <WH4735> of flocks, <WH6629> and possession <WH4735> of herds, <WH1241> and great store <WH7227> of servants: <WH5657> and the Philistines <WH6430> envied <WH7065> him.

For all <WH3605> the wells <WH875> which <WH834> his father's <WH1> servants <WH5650> had digged <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father, <WH1> the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them, and filled <WH4390> them with earth. <WH6083>
And Abimelech <WH40> said <WH559> unto <WH413> Isaac, <WH3327> Go <WH1980> from <WH4480> <WH5973> us; for <WH3588> thou art much mightier <WH6105> <WH3966> than <WH4480> we.
And Isaac <WH3327> departed <WH1980> thence, <WH4480> <WH8033> and pitched his tent <WH2583> in the valley <WH5158> of Gerar, <WH1642> and dwelt <WH3427> there. <WH8033>

And Isaac <WH3327> digged <WH2658> again <WH7725> <WH853> the wells <WH875> of water, <WH4325> which <WH834> they had digged <WH2658> in the days <WH3117> of Abraham <WH85> his father; <WH1> for the Philistines <WH6430> had stopped <WH5640> them after <WH310> the death <WH4194> of Abraham: <WH85> and he called <WH7121> their names <WH8034> after the names <WH8034> by which <WH834> his father <WH1> had called <WH7121> them.
And Isaac's <WH3327> servants <WH5650> digged <WH2658> in the valley, <WH5158> and found <WH4672> there <WH8033> a well <WH875> of springing <WH2416> water. <WH4325>

And the herdsmen <WH7462> of Gerar <WH1642> did strive <WH7378> with <WH5973> Isaac's <WH3327> herdsmen, <WH7462> saying, <WH559> The water <WH4325> is ours: and he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of the well <WH875> Esek; <WH6230> because <WH3588> they strove <WH6229> with <WH5973> him.
And they digged <WH2658> another <WH312> well, <WH875> and strove <WH7378> for <WH5921> that also: <WH1571> and he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of it Sitnah. <WH7856>

And he removed <WH6275> from thence, <WH4480> <WH8033> and digged <WH2658> another <WH312> well; <WH875> and for <WH5921> that they strove <WH7378> not: <WH3808> and he called <WH7121> the name <WH8034> of it Rehoboth; <WH7344> and he said, <WH559> For <WH3588> now <WH6258> the LORD <WH3068> hath made room <WH7337> for us, and we shall be fruitful <WH6509> in the land. <WH776>
And he went up <WH5927> from thence <WH4480> <WH8033> to Beer-sheba. <WH884>

And the LORD <WH3068> appeared <WH7200> unto <WH413> him the same <WH1931> night, <WH3915> and said, <WH559> I <WH595> am the God <WH430> of Abraham <WH85> thy father: <WH1> fear <WH3372> not, <WH408> for <WH3588> I <WH595> am with <WH854> thee, and will bless <WH1288> thee, and multiply <WH7235> <WH853> thy seed <WH2233> for <WH5668> my servant <WH5650> Abraham's <WH85> sake.

And he built <WH1129> an altar <WH4196> there, <WH8033> and called <WH7121> upon the name <WH8034> of the LORD, <WH3068> and pitched <WH5186> his tent <WH168> there: <WH8033> and there <WH8033> Isaac's <WH3327> servants <WH5650> digged <WH3738> a well. <WH875>

Then Abimelech <WH40> went <WH1980> to <WH413> him from Gerar, <WH4480> <WH1642> and Ahuzzath <WH276> one of his friends, <WH4828> and Phichol <WH6369> the chief captain <WH8269> of his army. <WH6635>
And Isaac <WH3327> said <WH559> unto <WH413> them, Wherefore <WH4069> come <WH935> ye to <WH413> me, seeing ye <WH859> hate <WH8130> me, and have sent me away <WH7971> from <WH4480> you?

And they said, <WH559> We saw certainly <WH7200> <WH7200> that <WH3588> the LORD <WH3068> was <WH1961> with <WH5973> thee: and we said, <WH559> Let there be <WH1961> now <WH4994> an oath <WH423> between <WH996> us, even between <WH996> us and thee, and let us make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with <WH5973> thee;

That <WH518> thou wilt do <WH6213> us no hurt, <WH7451> as <WH834> we have not <WH3808> touched <WH5060> thee, and as <WH834> we have done <WH6213> unto <WH5973> thee nothing but <WH7535> good, <WH2896> and have sent thee away <WH7971> in peace: <WH7965> thou <WH859> art now <WH6258> the blessed <WH1288> of the LORD. <WH3068>
And he made <WH6213> them a feast, <WH4960> and they did eat <WH398> and drink. <WH8354>

And they rose up quickly <WH7925> in the morning, <WH1242> and swore <WH7650> one <WH376> to another: <WH251> and Isaac <WH3327> sent them away, <WH7971> and they departed <WH1980> from <WH4480> <WH854> him in peace. <WH7965>

And it came to pass <WH1961> the same <WH1931> day, <WH3117> that Isaac's <WH3327> servants <WH5650> came, <WH935> and told <WH5046> him concerning <WH5921> <WH182> the well <WH875> which <WH834> they had digged, <WH2658> and said <WH559> unto him, We have found <WH4672> water. <WH4325>
And he called <WH7121> it Shebah: <WH7656> therefore <WH5921> <WH3651> the name <WH8034> of the city <WH5892> is Beer-sheba <WH884> unto <WH5704> this <WH2088> day. <WH3117>

And Esau <WH6215> was <WH1961> forty <WH705> years <WH8141> old <WH1121> when he took <WH3947> to wife <WH802> <WH853> Judith <WH3067> the daughter <WH1323> of Beeri <WH882> the Hittite, <WH2850> and Bashemath <WH1315> the daughter <WH1323> of Elon <WH356> the Hittite: <WH2850>
Which were <WH1961> a grief <WH4786> of mind <WH7307> unto Isaac <WH3327> and to Rebekah. <WH7259>
